plot: Traversability, Reconfiguration, and Reachability in the Gadget Framework
summary: Consider an agent traversing a graph of "gadgets", each with local state that changes with each traversal by the agent. They characterize the complexity of universal traversal, where the goal is to traverse every gadget at least once, for DAG gadgets, one-state gadgets, and reversible deterministic gadgets. They also study the. complexity of reconfiguration, where. the goal. is to bring the system of gadgets to a specified state, proving many cases PSPACE-complete.
